borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason:To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by S.51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act  2004)

The development hereby permitted shall not be commenced until details/samples of all materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development including the floodlight columns and luminaires have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved materials.Reason:  To protect or enhance the character and amenity of the area in accordance with policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The development shall not be commenced until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the position, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected. No part of the development shall be occupied until the approved boundary treatment for that part has been provided.  The approved boundary treatment shall be retained unless the Local Planning Authority gives prior written approval for its removal.	Reason:  To ensure the boundary treatment protects or enhances the character and amenity of the area in accordance with policy BP11 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The club house building hereby permitted shall only be in use between the hours of 8am to 10.30pm.Reason: In order to prevent noise nuisance to neighbouring residents and in accordance with policies BP8 and BR13 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The floodlights hereby permitted shall only be illuminated between the hours of 9am to 10pm on any day.Reason: In order to minimise light pollution and prevent nuisance to neighbouring residents and in accordance with policy BP8 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

Prior to the commencement of the development details of the luminance and spread of the floodlighting, which shall be designed to minimise the impact on bat habitat and residential amenity, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The floodlighting shall be installed and thereafter operated in accordance with the approved details.Reason: In order to prevent harm to bat habitat and to minimise light pollution and in accordance with policy CR2 of the Core Strategy and policies BP8 and BR3 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

Prior to demolition of the club house a bat survey of the building (internally and externally) and a bat emergence survey (requiring a minimum of 3 visits between May and August) shall be carried out by a licenced ecologist and the survey results submitted to the Local Planning Authority.  If evidence of a bat roost is found details of a mitigation strategy shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in consultation with Natural England.  The strategy shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  If demolition is delayed until April 2015, the surveys must be repeated in accordance with the above details.Reason: In order to protect bats (a protected species) and in accordance with accordance with policy CR2 of the Core Strategy and policy BR3 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

In addition to the requirements of condition 8 a demolition methodology designed to prevent harm to potential bat habitat shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Demolition shall be carried out in accordance with the approved methodology, if during demolition evidence of bat habitat is found, work shall cease until the submission to and approval by the Local Planning Authority in consultation with Natural England of a habitat mitigation strategy.  Demolition shall not be re-commenced until the completion of the approved mitigation strategy.Reason: In order to protect bats (a protected species) and in accordance with accordance with policy CR2 of the Core Strategy and policy BR3 of the Borough Wide Development Policies Development Plan Document.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: BJT1325.A1 Rev. A; BJT1325.A2; BJT1325.A3 Rev. A, BJT1325.A4 Rev. A and BJT1325.A5 Rev. AReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
description: Demolition of clubhouse building and erection of replacement single storey clubhouse building and formation of 2 artificial surface pitches with four 10 metre high and four 15 metre high floodlight columns, and erection of perimeter fencing.
